title: Making friends here sucks ass
author: Early-Weird4
postText: I hate how hard it is to make friends here because most clubs and organizations are dead. I also am not a big fan of Greek life. This doesn't really seem like the type of school where people just walk up to each other and start conversations. Or maybe I'm just socially inept idk. Does anyone have any better ideas of how to start meeting new people?

comments.comment: Approaching strangers requires a social skill both you and I don’t have.
comments.author: Competitive_Run1499

comments.comment:
Organizations are the easiest, some are dead but there are a lot of passionate people that might share an interest with you. But honestly, you absolutely can just walk up to people and make friends. ppl play smash and gta on the second floor of student center, theres skaters at the greenspace.

if you wait for people to approach you, you'll be disappointed. taking the first step is way easier once you get used to it.
comments.author: PairsOfSunglasses

comments.comment: Might be because it's a commuter campus. At least personally, I don't put much effort into making any friends here and it's hard to take part in clubs/organizations where you might naturally make some when you have to justify a 2/+ hour commute to attend a 1 hour club or something.
comments.author: Servals94

comments.comment: You can absolutely walk up to people and start a conversation especially in the greenspace. Since it’s getting warmer outside and the sun is out more, there’s usually more people out there. And there are a couple organizations that aren’t completely dead (I’m prolly biased lol), but you just have to make an extra effort to reach out to people. But I’d personally say that complaining on Reddit is a great way of making friends tbh, I’ve met some people on here that I still hangout w today.
comments.author: WWJJF

comments.comment:
the most clubs and organizations being dead thing is so true. i joined 5 or 6 clubs last semester but 2-3 died after the first meeting. the eboard never sent anything in the groupme or put out other updates. 

but they’re all trying to come back this semester, don’t know how well it’ll work though.
comments.author: Baka_Kurisu

comments.comment: It is the school where you can walk up and make friends but most people can’t admit that they have terrible social skills. Also take into consideration that we are pass the midpoint mark so making new friends isn’t ontop of everyone’s list compared to how it was when the semester started.
comments.author: ChillwaveSos

comments.comment: Join a club that actually produces something, like Underground or Album 88. You work with other people and gain real skills. It's win-win.
comments.author: thousandpetals

comments.comment: If you're serious about making friends and are a non toxic individual then dm me bro I run the Campus Convo Podcast club we have around 15 members right now and are actively recruiting more members. We meet every Thursday to talk about anything and everything so if you wanna meet new people and talk about current events shoot me a message!
comments.author: The-Bubbles

comments.comment: People are over complicating things. I’ll tell you how to make friends here. Go to class, scan the room, and sit next to the most interesting person you can find. The smart guy, smart girl, cute guy, cute girl. Just sit next to someone. This isn’t the men’s bathroom where you need space between your stall. Talk about class. Exchange numbers. Meet before class to review for your quizzes. “Hey my friend would like to join us, can she/he? Yeah sure no problem”. That’s how your friend group grows. Eventually you meet after class and even the next semester.
comments.author: gsuboiboi

comments.comment: I think it’s hard making friends at any school. However, it might be harder if you don’t live on campus ? Do you live on campus?
comments.author: SereneNeed7

replies.comment: Yeah I live on campus. I think I might need to just grow a pair and learn how to socialize lol
replies.author: Early-Weird4

replies.comment: Maybe you should try Bumble BFF. It’s an app that can help you find friends. You set your location and the age range of people you want to meet. You can match with people and meet up. I used the app a while ago and there were soooo many GSU, Georgia Tech, Clark Atlanta, etc., students on there. Might be worth a try.
replies.author: SereneNeed7

replies.comment: Are they normal people lol, and do u still use it
replies.author: Exciting-Corner-6996

replies.comment:
Yes, I met one of my closest friends on there. I stopped using it after I made a few friends. I didn’t feel the need to keep using it. However, it might be helpful to get your foot out there. Once you start meeting people and they start introducing you to other people, you probably won’t feel the need to keep using it either. It’s just a good starting point, in my opinion.

When you set your criteria, you can choose to only see people your age or your gender, etc. Of course when you meet people you should probably plan to meet in a group of at least 3 and meet up in the day time in a public setting. However, most of the people you’ll see on there will probably be students just like you who are just looking for friends.
replies.author: SereneNeed7

comments.comment: When I was a freshman it was relatively easy to make friends, however that was before covid. I had a couple of people just walk up to me and start conversation. I will say, if you’re a freshman, a lot of people are in the same position you are. One way that I made friends was through my classes. You could always ask someone in your classes if they wanted to study together or something like that.
comments.author: ganjaporium420

replies.comment: Idk I feel the different about it. For me it became a lot easier to meet good friends as you get into your major and share classes with a lot of the same people too semester after semester. More likely to meet people with common interests as well. Don’t lose hope if you’re a sophomore lol.
replies.author: tommyhateseveryone

replies.comment: Thanks for the advice. I'm a freshman so hopefully I meet some more like-minded people once I get my pre-reqs out of the way.
replies.author: Early-Weird4

comments.comment: You can make friends through group chats as well! I run a major group chat with a lot of members
comments.author: GSUGuide21

comments.comment: No great suggestions unfortunately, other than just be content with being alone and doing things alone and eventually you’ll meet people with things in common, it just takes time. However, as someone who goes to Tech, making friends here sucks ass and then some. Good luck!!
comments.author: Funny_Bath_9603
